summary: This is an email from February 6, 2020, discussing the preparation of subpoenas to Interlochen Center for the Arts for records related to Jeffrey Epstein and Ghislaine Maxwell. The email notes Interlochen's attorney confirmed they will not disclose a subpoena for donor records but are obligated under FERPA to disclose a subpoena for student records to the affected students. The sender requests review of the drafted subpoenas before sending them to supervisors.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Mentioned as a donor whose records are being sought via subpoena to Interlochen Center for the Arts.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: Mentioned alongside Epstein as a donor whose records are being sought via subpoena to Interlochen Center for the Arts.

connections.description: Both are named together as donors whose records are being subpoenaed from Interlochen, indicating a joint financial connection to the institution.

events.title: Drafting of Subpoenas to Interlochen
events.description: Subpoenas were drafted to obtain records from Interlochen Center for the Arts regarding donations by Epstein and Maxwell, and student records.

events.title: Email Coordination on Subpoenas
events.description: Email sent to coordinate review and approval of drafted subpoenas for Interlochen records before sending to supervisors.

keyFacts: Interlochen's attorney confirmed they will not disclose a subpoena for donor records related to Epstein and Maxwell.
Interlochen is obligated under FERPA to disclose a subpoena for student records to the affected students.
Two separate subpoenas were drafted: one for donor information with a non-disclosure request, and one for student information with a Non-Disclosure Order (NDO) package.
The email shows ongoing investigative efforts in February 2020 to obtain records from institutions connected to Epstein and Maxwell.
The correspondence indicates coordination between legal team members before submitting subpoenas to supervisors ('chiefs').
